TI: Lateral temporal lobectomy with hippocampal disconnection as an alternative surgical technique for temporal lobe epilepsy.
AB: Temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) is conventionally surgically treated by anterior temporal lobectomy. Temporal disconnection surgery has been proposed to minimize the complications associated with standard temporal lobectomy with comparable seizure control. We report a patient with seizures secondary to hippocampal herniation treated successfully with lateral temporal lobectomy and hippocampal disconnection.
AD: Division of Neurosurgery, Toronto Western Hospital, Toronto, Canada. wai_hoe_ng@nni.com.sg <wai_hoe_ng@nni.com.sg>
JT: Journal of clinical neuroscience : official journal of the Neurosurgical Society of Australasia
